item.title: Innovation & Collaboration
item.description: This is a presentation I gave at Miami Ad School in DUMBO to a class on digital product development. It focuses on how digital products are ripe for co-creation, which I think (hope?) will be a key element of the future of agencies.

item.title: Building a sales & marketing machine
item.description: Describes the steps required to build a Sales and Marketing Machine that is predictable, scalable, automated, well instrumented, and cost efficient. This was a presentation that I gave at the Lean Startup Circle in Boston on March 24th, 2011.

item.title: PeopleBrowsr Presents A Brief Cartoon History of Social Networking 1930-2011
item.description: Illustrating current social media sensations, such as Rebecca Black and Charlie Sheen, and historical milestones dating back to the 1930s, PeopleBrowsr’s History of Social Networking Timeline has been released in honor of the Advertising Research Foundation’s 75th Anniversary. PeopleBrowsr, the high-tech social analytics and engagement company, commissioned the artwork for the San Francisco Command Center, as part of the company’s ongoing commitment to analyzing emerging trends, curating and documenting social media. The artist, Adam Long, has transformed the social media research PeopleBrowsr compiled into incredible illustrations that are delightful and easy to understand.
item.content:encoded: Illustrating current social media sensations, such as Rebecca Black and Charlie Sheen, and historical milestones dating back to the 1930s, PeopleBrowsr’s History of Social Networking Timeline has been released in honor of the Advertising Research Foundation’s 75th Anniversary. PeopleBrowsr, the high-tech social analytics and engagement company, commissioned the artwork for the San Francisco Command Center, as part of the company’s ongoing commitment to analyzing emerging trends, curating and documenting social media. The artist, Adam Long, has transformed the social media research PeopleBrowsr compiled into incredible illustrations that are delightful and easy to understand.
item.author: peoplebrowsr@slideshare.net(peoplebrowsr)

media:content.media:title: PeopleBrowsr Presents A Brief Cartoon History of Social Networking 1930-2011
media:content.media:description:
Illustrating current social media sensations, such as Rebecca Black and Charlie Sheen, and historical milestones dating back to the 1930s, PeopleBrowsr's History of Social Networking Timeline has been released in honor of the Advertising Research Foundation’s 75th Anniversary.
PeopleBrowsr, the high-tech social analytics and engagement company, commissioned the artwork for the San Francisco Command Center, as part of the company’s ongoing commitment to analyzing emerging trends, curating and documenting social media.
The artist, Adam Long, has transformed the social media research PeopleBrowsr compiled into incredible illustrations that are delightful and easy to understand.

The artist, Adam Long, has transformed the social media research PeopleBrowsr compiled into incredible illustrations that are delightful and easy to understand.
